item.title: secret held if bin laden lived here, village says
item.description: if bin laden ever hid in chak shah muhammad, a small farming village in pakistan, the residents said they would have known.

item.title: euro zone hit by greek restructuring worry
item.description: greece faced a new surge in its debt costs on thursday after germany said for the first time that athens may need to restructure its debt, a move one central banker warned would be a "catastrophe."

item.title: cole out of u.s. "x factor"; accent not to blame
item.description: british singer cheryl cole's replacement on the much-hyped u.s. version of "the x factor" was confirmed on monday, ending almost two weeks of rumor and speculation about the line-up.

item.title: france's lagarde says premature to discuss imf post
item.description: french finance minister christine lagarde said monday it was "premature" to discuss whether she would win the top job at the imf and insisted any selection process should be open, transparent and merit-based.

item.title: xerox reports rise in profit and revenue
item.description: the company's earnings beat analysts' estimates by 2 cents as revenue rose 16 percent.

item.title: radiation level falls at japan fukushima plant: agency
item.description: the level of radiation detected at the tokyo electric power co fukushima plant has fallen steadily over the past 12 hours, an official at japan's nuclear and industrial safety agency said on thursday.

item.title: british man jailed after record fake medicine bust
item.description: a british man was jailed for eight years on friday for his role in supplying more than 2 million doses of fake medicines in the most serious known case of counterfeit drugs getting into the european supply chain.

item.title: sean payton: 'i'd be surprised' if reggie bush leaves saints
item.description: new orleans saints coach sean payton said saturday he anticipates rb reggie bush coming back and being a part of his team next season.

item.description: the coast guard closed a stretch of the swollen mississippi to barge traffic upstream friday, then reopened it later in the day.

item.title: california dreaming: a return to issuance
item.description: with supplies of new municipal bonds running well below forecasts for this year, california's return to the market in the second half of the year could exert quite an impact.

item.title: two swedes jailed for life for philippine internet porn

item.title: poulter's match play win denies donald top ranking
item.description: ian poulter beat luke donald in the world match play championship final on sunday to deny his fellow briton the world number one ranking.

item.title: asia, price rises spice up mccormick profit

item.description: a pair of top u.s. manufacturers topped wall street's profit expectations, as a recovering global economy drives demand for products ranging from air conditioners to truck transmissions.

item.description: to keep the hits rolling, zynga is releasing a game in which players build island nations and team up with friends to fend off attacks from intruders.

item.description: several pockets of the u.s. are beginning to gray as baby boomers start hitting 65.

item.description: toyota is warning its u.s. dealers of a new-car shortage this summer.

item.title: alaska militia charged in murder-kidnap plot
item.description: five fairbanks-area residents involved in a loose-knit militia group have been arrested in connection with a plot to kidnap or kill alaska state troopers and a local judge, federal and state authorities said on friday.

item.title: is it torture? those who decide have not felt it
item.description: those who approve "enhanced interrogation techniques" probably have a flawed idea of whether this constitutes torture, because few have felt the pain these methods can cause, researchers reported monday.

item.title: in japan, seawall offered a false sense of security
item.description: a japanese town's faith in a seawall and its ability to save residents from any tsunami was so unshakable, that some rushed toward it after the earthquake struck.

item.title: states in budget paradox: more money, more gaps

item.title: dazzling sharapova surges into paris semi-finals

item.title: "gangsta of love" charged with exposing partners to hiv

item.title: u.n. human rights body approves investigator on iran

item.description: in many emerging markets, half of a family budget goes to food. raise prices a bit and it can mean one meal a day instead of two.

item.title: outsider martelly sweeps haiti's presidential election

item.title: iceland government survives no-confidence vote
